lines.text: I'd like permission to carry a gun.
A gun? Why?
Because I'm joining in on this hunt and it might come in handy.
I can appreciate how you feel, seor, but take my advice and go back to your ranch.
In other words, that's a polite way of sayin' no, isn't it?
(laughing) Yes. This is a matter for the police.
I'm sorry, Captain. Gun or no gun, or whether you like it or not, I'm not leavin' this town until I find out who murdered my partner. Let's go, Pokie.
If you guys could find stray calves as well as you can find pretty girls, you'd be the best cowpokes in this country.
You put a rose in their hair and we'd find them.
Where's Dusty?
Over at the El Molino Verde cantina tryin' to put his brand on a little entertainer named Elena.
Let's go see how he's gettin' along.
Nothin' doin'. We got a little brandin' job of our own to take care of.
String wire? I'm sorry, Gene, but I'm workin' on something else.
Blonde or redhead?
See for yourself
[nods at the lovely Elena]
Not bad. I'd like to meet her myself.
So would I.
[singing]
I had two trusty pistols, had me two leather holsters hangin' by my side. I had a two-gaited pony till the day matrimony took my bridle and gave me a bride...
[someone throws a knife at Pokie, pinning his hat to the wall beside him]
That's all, folks.
[first lines]
Welcome to the carnival, senor.
Thanks. Viva Mexico!
Viva United States!
Yeah. Viva pretty girls!
